workspaceID.description: Workspace ID your project belongs to. This will mach same folder name in the root of your user directory. ie `~/` on macOS

projectName.description: Name of the project which will be used in workspace as folder name. this will also be used as part of the KEY in crypto env var generator

isMonorepo.description: Mark if your project is part of monorepo

enabled.description: Defines whether build scheme shows up in options to run

description.description: Custom description of the buildScheme will be displayed directly in cli if you run rnv with an empty paramener `-s`

id.description: Bundle ID of application. ie: com.example.myapp

assetFolderPlatform.description: Alternative platform assets. This is useful for example when you want to use same android assets in androidtv and want to avoid duplicating assets

runtime.description: This object will be automatically injected into `./platfromAssets/renative.runtime.json` making it possible to inject the values directly to JS source code

engine.description: ID of engine to be used for this platform. Note: engine must be registered in `engines` field

extra.description: Object ysed to extend your renative with custom props. This allows renative json schema to be validated

entryFile.description: Alternative name of the entry file without `.js` extension

bundleAssets.description: If set to `true` compiled js bundle file will generated. this is needed if you want to make production like builds

enableSourceMaps.description: If set to `true` dedicated source map file will be generated alongside of compiled js bundle

bundleIsDev.description: If set to `true` debug build will be generated

includedPermissions.description: Allows you to include specific permissions by their KEY defined in `permissions` object. Use: `['*']` to include all

excludedPermissions.description: Allows you to exclude specific permissions by their KEY defined in `permissions` object. Use: `['*']` to exclude all

title.description: Title of your app will be used to create title of the binary. ie App title of installed app iOS/Android app or Tab title of the website

description.description: General description of your app. This prop will be injected to actual projects where description field is applicable

includedFonts.description: Array of fonts you want to include in specific app or scheme. Should use exact font file (without the extension) located in `./appConfigs/base/fonts` or `*` to mark all

backgroundColor.description: Defines root view backgroundColor for all platforms in HEX format

fontSources.description: Array of paths to location of external Fonts. you can use resolve function here example: `{{resolvePackage(react-native-vector-icons)}}/Fonts`

assetSources.description: Array of paths to alternative external assets. this will take priority over ./appConfigs/base/assets folder on your local project. You can use resolve function here example: `{{resolvePackage(@flexn/template-starter)}}/appConfigs/base/assets`

includedPlugins.description:
Defines an array of all included plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in `plugin` should be used.

NOTE: includedPlugins is evaluated before excludedPlugins. Use: `['*']` to include all

excludedPlugins.description:
Defines an array of all excluded plugins for specific config or buildScheme. only full keys as defined in `plugin` should be used.

NOTE: excludedPlugins is evaluated after includedPlugins. Use: `['*']` to exclude all

common.description: Common config props used as default props for all available buildSchemes

ports.description: Allows you to assign custom port per each supported platform specific to this project. this is useful if you foten switch between multiple projects and do not want to experience constant port conflicts

supportedPlatforms.description: Array list of all supported platforms in current project

portOffset.description: Offset each port default value by increment

schemes.description: List of default schemes for each platform. This is useful if you want to avoid specifying `-s ...` every time your run rnv command. bu default rnv uses `-s debug`. NOTE: you can only use schemes you defined in `buildSchemes`

targets.description: Override of default targets specific to this project

defaults.description: Default system config for this project

pipes.description: To avoid rnv building `buildHooks/src` every time you can specify which specific pipes should trigger recompile of buildHooks

templates.description:
Stores installed templates info in your project.

NOTE: This prop will be updated by rnv if you run `rnv template install`

currentTemplate.description: Currently active template used in this project. this allows you to re-bootstrap whole project by running `rnv template apply`

dest.description: Location of encrypted file in your project used as destination of encryption from your workspace

source.description: Location of encrypted file in your project used as source of decryption into your workspace

crypto.description: This prop enables automatic encrypt and decrypt of sensitive information in your project

appConfigsDir.description: Custom path to appConfigs. defaults to `./appConfigs`

platformTemplatesDirs.description: Custom location of ejected platform templates. this is populated after you run `rnv platform eject`

appConfigsDirs.description: Array of custom location app configs directories`

platformAssetsDir.description: Custom path to platformAssets folder. defaults to `./platformAssets`

platformBuildsDir.description: Custom path to platformBuilds folder. defaults to `./platformBuilds`

paths.description: Define custom paths for RNV to look into

permissions.description: Permission definititions which can be used by app configs via `includedPermissions` and `excludedPermissions` to customize permissions for each app

engines.description: List of engines available in this project

enableHookRebuild.description: If set to true in `./renative.json` build hooks will be compiled at each rnv command run. If set to `false` (default) rebuild will be triggered only if `dist` folder is missing, `-r` has been passed or you run `rnv hooks run` directly making your rnv commands faster

monoRoot.description: Define custom path to monorepo root where starting point is project directory

enableAnalytics.description: Enable or disable sending analytics to improve ReNative

extendsTemplate.description: You can extend another renative.json file of currently applied template by providing relative or full package name path. Exampe: `@rnv/template-starter/renative.json`

tasks.description: Allows to override specific task within renative toolchain. (currently only `install` supported). this is useful if you want to change specific behaviour of built-in task. ie install task triggers yarn/npm install by default. but that might not be desirable installation trigger

integrations.description: Object containing integration configurations where key represents package name

excludedArchs.description: Defines excluded architectures. This transforms to xcodeproj: `EXCLUDED_ARCHS="<VAL VAL ...>"`

urlScheme.description: URL Scheme for the app used for deeplinking

buildSchemes.description: Allows to customize platforms configurations based on chosen build scheme `-s`

reactNativeEngine.description: Allows you to define specific native render engine to be used

minSdkVersion.description: Minimum Android SDK version device has to have in order for app to run

multipleAPKs.description: If set to `true`, apk will be split into multiple ones for each architecture: "armeabi-v7a", "x86", "arm64-v8a", "x86_64"

gradle_properties.description: Overrides values in `gradle.properties` file of generated android based project

build_gradle.description: Overrides values in `build.gradle` file of generated android based project

app_build_gradle.description: Overrides values in `app/build.gradle` file of generated android based project

AndroidManifest_xml.description:
Allows you to directly manipulate `AndroidManifest.xml` via json override mechanism
Injects / Overrides values in AndroidManifest.xml file of generated android based project
> IMPORTANT: always ensure that your object contains `tag` and `android:name` to target correct tag to merge into

MainApplication_java.description: Allows you to configure behaviour of MainActivity

aab.description: If set to true, android project will generate app.aab instead of apk

extraGradleParams.description: Allows passing extra params to gradle command

minifyEnabled.description: Sets minifyEnabled buildType property in app/build.gradle

targetSdkVersion.description: Allows you define custom targetSdkVersion equivalent to: `targetSdkVersion = [VERSION]` in build.gradle

compileSdkVersion.description: Allows you define custom compileSdkVersion equivalent to: `compileSdkVersion = [VERSION]` in build.gradle

kotlinVersion.description: Allows you define custom kotlin version

gradleBuildToolsVersion.description: Allows you define custom gradle build tools version equivalent to:  `classpath 'com.android.tools.build:gradle:[VERSION]'`

gradleWrapperVersion.description: Allows you define custom gradle wrapper version equivalent to: `distributionUrl=https\://services.gradle.org/distributions/gradle-[VERSION]-all.zip`

excludedFeatures.description: Override features definitions in AndroidManifest.xml by exclusion

includedFeatures.description: Override features definitions in AndroidManifest.xml by inclusion

version.description: Version of plugin. Typically package version

deprecated.description: Marks your plugin deprecated with warning showing in the console during rnv commands

source.description:
Will define custom scope for your plugin config to extend from.

NOTE: custom scopes can be defined via paths.pluginTemplates.[CUSTOM_SCOPE].{}

no-npm.description: Will skip including plugin in package.json and installing it via npm/yarn etc

skipMerge.description:
Will not attempt to merge with existing plugin configuration (ie. coming form renative pluginTemplates)

NOTE: if set to `true` you need to configure your plugin object fully

npm.description: Object of npm dependencies of this plugin. These will be injected into package.json

pluginDependencies.description: List of other Renative plugins this plugin depends on

webpack.description: Allows you to configure webpack bahaviour per each individual plugin

disablePluginTemplateOverrides.description: Disables plugin overrides for selected plugin

enabled.description: Marks plugin platform enabled or disabled

path.description: Enables you to pass custom path to plugin. If undefined, the default `node_modules/[plugin-name]` will be used.

templateAndroid.description: Allows more advanced modifications to Android based project template

git.description: Alternative git url for pod instead of version

templateXcode.description: Allows more advanced modifications to Xcode based project template

plugins.description: Define all plugins available in your project. you can then use `includedPlugins` and `excludedPlugins` props to define active and inactive plugins per each app config
